description.narrative: 60 male youth (aged 11-21) have built their capacities, increased their knowledge of their rights, and increased their level of PSS well being . Through the trainings available they will have improved their employability skills and will be better equipped to deal with their anxieties and tensions in the prison, without resorting to violence. Once released from the prison, MSL's follow up support will help children reintegrate into their communities. This, combined with the skills and support they receive in prison, will decrease the likelihood of recidivism and help the beneficiaries to find employment.

One of Lebanese government has dealt with the Syrian refugee crisis is to imprison young Syrian boys to get them off the streets, often leaving them in prison for years without charging them, or by accusing them of trumped up charges. Our partner MSL has been working in the youth wing of the Roumieh prison since the 1990s, and is well placed to work with Syrian and Lebanese children to provide psychosocial, socio-economic and juridical support. Activities will include: Delivery of 4 vocational trainings for 60 male youth in Roumieh prison on Computer hardware, hairdressing, leather work and wood work. Provision of individual and collective social and psychological support for 60 minors on the basis of 30 sessions per month. Sessions include Communication, Conflict resolution, Mediation and Art expression and one recreational event. Provision of information sharing on legal rights to 60 male youth, and full legal representation to 1 beneficiary (selected based on difficulty of their case, vulnerability, family situation).
